captions.text:
I’M ALEX FARNHAM AND THIS IS ANIMALIST NEWS.
DO YOU REMEMBER WOOLLY MAMMOTHS?

YOU KNOW, THOSE GIANT, HAIRY ELEPHANT LIKE
CREATURES WITH THE LONG CURVY TUSKS?

WELL ONCE AGAIN, SCIENTISTS THINK THEY’RE
CLOSER TO BRINGING THEM BACK TO LIFE!

BUT WHY WOULD WE WANT MAMMOTHS BACK STOMPING
AROUND ON EARTH? WELL, MOSTLY JUST BECAUSE

THEY’RE AWESOME. HERE ARE FIVE COOL FACTS
ABOUT THE WOOLLY MAMMOTH.

NUMBER FIVE: MAMMOTHS WEREN’T ALL THAT BIG...
ASIDE FROM THE SONGHUA RIVER MAMMOTH, WHICH

WAS ESTIMATED TO STAND 17 FEET TALL...MOST
WERE NOT ALL THAT MUCH BIGGER THAN OUR MODERN

DAY ELEPHANTS.
THERE WERE ALSO LITTLE GUYS TOO!

THE PYGMY MAMMOTH LIVED ON THE CHANNEL ISLANDS
NEAR CALIFORNIA, AND STOOD ONLY ABOUT 6 FEET

NUMBER FOUR: MAMMOTH'S ONLY HAD 4 TEETH! THEY
USED GIANT MOLARS TO BREAK DOWN TOUGH PLANT

MATTER. ONLY THING IS THEY DIDN’T CHEW IT,
INSTEAD THEY WOULD RUB THEIR TEETH BACK AND

NUMBER THREE: ALTHOUGH WOOLLY MAMMOTHS WERE
AROUND OVER A MILLION YEARS AGO, THE LAST

MAMMOTHS 
WERE AROUND ONLY 4,000 YEARS AGO! WHILE MOST
WOOLLIES

comments.author: Slime “Touhoulover” Bunny

comments.text:
While I'm pretty sure bringing a woolly mammoth back to life would awesome, 
it probably won't be the first extinct animal to clone. Honestly,would you 
rather clone a small dodo bird you can treat like a chicken and keep alive 
on a minimum budget, or would you rather have a giant mammoth that not only 
eats (and poops) a lot, but can also cause a lot of damage when provoked or 
frightened. And, I honestly don't see mammoths being kept as farm animals 
being very practical. They'd most likely be kept as wildlife park and zoo 
attractions.

As for favorite extinct animal, it's gotta be the Tyrannosaurus Rex. 
Honestly, who could argue?﻿
